p: The direct consequences of eradication will include the prevention every year of thousands of deaths and permanent paralysis of hundreds of thousands of people, especially children.[ 52] This will yield up to at least US$ 25 billion in net benefits over the next 20 years. In summary, in this journey of achieving the goal of eradication of polio from the globe, these additional governance mechanisms have certainly strengthened and broadened the participation and oversight of the polio program. The role of global health diplomacy is enormous in bringing all the stakeholders together, have successful negotiations to ensure adequate funding and commitment by all partners to eradicate globally. The governance of GPEI would still benefit from adopting some of the best practices in governance from other organizations in the global health sector.
